DataElement.preferredName: Patient Other Medical Contraindicated Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable coded response regarding whether there were additional or unlisted medical contraindications of patient .

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the additional or unlisted medical contraindications of patient .

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:Medical; relating to the study or practice of medicine.:To indicate the inadvisability of (a medical treatment, for example). (Dictionary.com)

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Relating to the study or practice of medicine.
State of a particular method of treatment, regimen, procedure, medication, etc. of being unsuitable and inadvisable, often because of a likely adverse reaction.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have any conditi
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any condition or medical problem in addition to the underlying malignancy and organ dysfunction which the investigator feels would pose unacceptable risk?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have history or current evidence of any condition, therapy, or laboratory abnormality that might confound the results of the trial, interfere with the patient's participation for the full duration of the trial, or is not in the best interest of the patient to participate, in the opinion of the treating investigator?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any other medical or psychiatric condition that in the opinion of the investigator would make the study therapy unsafe for the patient?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any medical, psychological, or social condition that, in the opinion of the investigator, may increase the patient's risk, interfere with the patient's participation in the study, or hinder evaluation of study results?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have medical or psychiatric illness or social situations that would in the opinion of the investigator, preclude participation in the study or the ability of patient to provide informed consent for themselves?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have current life-threatening illness, medical condition, or organ system dysfunction, which, in the Investigator's opinion, could compromise the patient's safety, or put the study at risk?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any condition that in the opinion of the treating investigator would interfere with evaluation of the investigational product or interpretation of subject safety or study results?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any co-morbid systemic illnesses or other severe concurrent disease which, in the judgment of the investigator, would make the patient inappropriate for entry into this study or interfere significantly with the proper assessment of safety and toxicity of the prescribed regimens?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have condition that, in the opinion of the Investigator, would interfere with evaluation of the investigational treatment or interpretation of patient safety or study results?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any serious and/or unstable pre-existing medical disorder (aside from malignancy exception above), psychiatric disorder, or other conditions that could interfere with subject's safety, obtaining informed consent or compliance to the study procedures?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any underlying medical condition which, in the opinion of the principal investigator, will make the administration of study drug hazardous or obscure the interpretation of adverse events?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any condition which in the Investigator's opinion deems the participant an unsuitable candidate to receive study drug. (i.e., any significant medical illness or abnormal laboratory finding that would increase the patient's risk by participating in this study)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any other prior or ongoing condition that in the opinion of the investigator could adversely affect the safety of the patient or impair the assessment of study results?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any medical or other condition which, in the opinion of the investigator, would preclude participation in a clinical trial or the investigator's belief that the subject is medically unfit to receive eribulin mesylate and atezolizumab or unsuitable for any other reason?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: In the judgment of the investigator is the patient unlikely to comply with study procedures, restrictions and requirements and therefore should not participate in the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any other severe, acute, or chronic medical or psychiatric condition or laboratory abnormality that may increase the risk associated with study participation or study drug administration or that may interfere with the interpretation of study results and, in the judgment of the investigator, would make the patient inappropriate for the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: In the judgment of the investigator is the patient unlikely to comply with study procedures, restrictions and requirements and therefore should not participate in the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any serious medical or psychiatric illness that could, in the investigator's opinion, potentially interfere with the completion of treatment according to this protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness that in the physician's assessment would pose undue risk for biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have other severe acute or chronic medical conditions including immune colitis, inflammatory bowel disease, immune pneumonitis, pulmonary fibrosis, or psychiatric conditions including recent (within the past year) or active suicidal ideation or behavior, or laboratory abnormalities that may increase the risk associated with study participation or study treatment administration or may interfere with the interpretation of study results and, in the judgment of the investigator, would make the patient inappropriate for entry into this study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any other medical conditions which are deemed by the principal investigator (or associates) to make the subject unsafe/ineligible for the protocol procedures or for radical prostatectomy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any co-morbid systemic illnesses or other severe concurrent disease which, in the judgment of the investigator, would make the patient inappropriate for entry into this study or interfere significantly with the proper assessment of safety and toxicity of the prescribed regimens?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 25
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any severe and/or uncontrolled medical conditions or other conditions that, in the opinion of the investigator, could affect their participation in the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a prior or concurrent malignancy whose natural history or treatment does not have the potential to interfere with the safety or efficacy assessment of the investigational regimen for this trial?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 26
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any other prior condition that could, in the opinion of the investigator, compromise patient safety or evaluation of the primary outcome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have prior or concurrent malignancy whose natural history or treatment has the potential to interfere with the safety or efficacy assessment of the investigational regimen for this trial?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 27
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any condition that, in the opinion of the Investigator, would interfere with evaluation of the investigational treatment or interpretation of patient safety or study results?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 28
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a prior or concurrent malignancy, its natural history or treatment does not have the potential to interfere with the safety or efficacy assessment of the investigational regimen for this trial?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 29
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any co-morbid condition that in the opinion of the investigator, might compromise the patient's safety, might interfere with participation the trial or might interfere with the interpretation of trial results?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any serious medical or psychiatric illness/condition, including substance use disorders likely in the judgement of the investigator to interfere or limit compliance with study requirements/treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 32
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any co-morbid condition that in the opinion of the investigator, might compromise the patient's safety, might interfere with participation in the trial or might interfere with the interpretation of trial results?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 33
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any other clinically significant disorders that would preclude safe study participation, such as serious non-healing wound/ulcer/bone fracture, uncompensated/symptomatic hypothyroidism, moderate to severe hepatic impairment (Child-Pugh B or C)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 31
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 34
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a severe and/or uncontrolled medical condition or other conditions that, in the opinion of the investigator, could affect their participation in the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 02
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any serious medical or psychiatric illness/condition, including substance use disorders or ophthalmological conditions, likely in the judgment of the investigator to interfere or limit compliance with study requirements/treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 35
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any serious medical condition or active uncontrolled infections (besides COVID-19) that, in the investigator's judgement, preclude the subject's safe participation in the study, such as  active TB infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 002
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any serious medical or psychiatric illness/condition, including substance use disorders or ophthalmological conditions, that is likely, in the judgment of the investigator, to interfere with, or limit compliance with, the study requirements/treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 36
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled intercurrent illness that in the treating physician's opinion would pose undue risk for biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 38
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient considered a poor medical risk due to a serious, uncontrolled medical disorder, non-malignant systemic disease or active, uncontrolled infection that, in the judgment of the investigator, would preclude participation in this study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 40
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have cardiac or pulmonary abnormalities severe enough that would pose a danger to receive treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 39
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a concomitant medical condition that, in the opinion of the investigator would increase the risk of toxicity?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 37
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have serious pre-existing medical condition(s) that would preclude participation in this study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 42
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any significant medical diseases that would worsen the risk-benefit ratio of participating in this study including but not limited to acute myocardial infarction within the last 6 months, unstable angina, significant acute or chronic infections, or severely immunocompromised state?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 43
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any condition deemed by the investigator to make the patient a poor candidate for clinical trial and/or treatment with investigational agents?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 41
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any other medical condition that in the opinion of investigator would place patient at increased risk for toxicity during pomalidomide treatment (i.e. history of recurrent or serious thromboembolic events such as massive pulmonary embolism)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 44
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an uncontrolled intercurrent illness that in the judgment of the investigator would make participation on this trial unsafe?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 45
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an uncontrolled intercurrent illness, prior malignancy, any other disease, metabolic dysfunction, physical examination finding, or clinical laboratory finding that contraindicates the use of an investigational drug, may affect the interpretation of the results, or may render the patient at high risk from treatment complications?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 46
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any other significant condition(s) that would make this protocol unreasonably hazardous?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 47
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have evidence of any significant, concomitant disease that could affect compliance with the protocol or interpretation of results as concomitant disease, including, but not limited to section 3.2.12?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 48
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have evidence of any significant, concomitant disease that could affect compliance with the protocol or interpretation of results as concomitant disease, including, but not limited to section 3.2.13?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 49
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any condition, including the presence of laboratory abnormalities, which places the subject at unacceptable risk if he/she were to participate in the study or confounds the ability to interpret data from the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 50
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any other any other significant condition(s), such as current greater than Grade 1 peripheral neuropathy; prior solid organ transplantation; known or suspected history of hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis (HLH); or a history of confirmed progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy (PML) that would make this protocol unreasonably hazardous?
